website_summaries.verdict: Despite some issues with the binding, this comprehensive and well-organized guide features a waterproof cover and thousands of photographs.
pros: Introduction section has articles on tree identification, ecology, and forest types
Features include quick-flip indexes, range maps, and unique identification tips for each tree
Covers more than 700 species, with over 2,000 photographs
cons: A little heavy and thick, making it more difficult to use in the field
Some reports that the book is poorly bound and obscures parts of pages or comes apart easily

customer_reviews.title: Pictures, but no Dichotomous key.
customer_reviews.text: This guide is good for looking through for a specific tree amongst pictures. It does NOT, however, provide a dichotomous key, which provides a step-by-step process of elimination. This book provides a key to leaves only, which is hard to do in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Even better than I thought it would be!
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I got this field guide. It has maps,clear photos of trunk bark (really needed!), leaves, fruits and info! The reviews seemed to be favorable but always mentioned it was too big to be portable in field. I was pleasantly surprised it was smaller than expected! Although it is pretty heavy it just attests to it being packed with info!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to another state and I wanted help identifying the local trees. I bought this book on the recommendation of my son, who is a wildland firefighter. He had researched several and found this book to the the most comprehensive and easy to use in the field. It has worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Windchime

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book! I was looking forever for a modern and informative tree guide and this is the one! So much detail and pictures for every tree.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The one book to rule them all
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Forester so over the years have collected every big name field guide available, e.g. Peterson, Nat. Audubon Society, etc. and this one hands down leaves the others in the dust. If you're in the natural resources field, Forestry student, ecology student, or just want to be able to identify trees with some very good general knowledge then this the one book to rule them all.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Refreshingly Useful
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a regular guy who has an unexplainable interest in trees. I've tried several books and attempted to navigate their various structures for reference. This book tops them all in ease of use. The set up is so easy to follow to find a tree you are trying to identify. The pictures are wonderful and accurate. It has a nice cover that is "waxy" for a damp situation. I have not attempted to identify a tree yet that I could not locate within this book. I looked at so many books trying to find one that is useful to the average guy, and i've finally found it.
customer_reviews.author: Zap Rowsdower

customer_reviews.title: field guide to north american trees
customer_reviews.text: great tree identification book, helped me identify the tree i was having trouble identifying.,also tells you the native areas of the trees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best book
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best if not the best book on trees ever. The pictures and descriptions are all great and far more inclusive than many other similar books. It is my go to book for identification and tree characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It has great detail about leaves and bark to help identify different ...
customer_reviews.text: I live on 40 acres, mostly wooded forest land and border the ozark national forest. I ordered this book to help identify trees and am so excited to began putting it to use. It has great detail about leaves and bark to help identify different trees. Love it and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HME1975

customer_reviews.title: Not a field guide
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hoping it would help me quickly identify local trees. Lovely book with lots of information but not easy to navigate and not a clear photo of each and every tree. Will probably end up on a shelf, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Jeda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to tree book. Full color and well-organized. Even though many of these trees don't grow where I live, I still enjoy reading about all the different types they have in America. I think they should list more oaks, as I have seen a couple in the wild that don't seem to be in the book (they might have been brought in from overseas). I also wish the book didn't automatically shut. What I mean is that it is thick and narrow, so holding it open takes more effort than a regular book. Anyway, if you are a tree lover, this is the book for you.
customer_reviews.author: GTS

customer_reviews.title: Good Tree Identity Book
customer_reviews.text: The book is well organized and interesting to read. It is a big help to learn more about so many types of interesting trees. The USA is blessed with wonderful trees. I'm glad I choose this book. It does not weigh me down with difficult technical terms. I am motivated to learn to identify many trees in our woods and beyond. 9-30-19
customer_reviews.author: M. Beavers

customer_reviews.title: The Tree Encyclopedia
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it's a bit large to lug around in your pocket. But of all the guides I looked at, this was the most complete and really the most useful. The layout is excellent and i find it quite easy to use, even for a beginner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: elfillinois

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: We refer to this book quite often as we travel around a lot and see lots of new and interesting trees. The descriptions are not brief, but if you're looking for a complete and thorough botanical description, you'll need the internet also. However, we have used this book to identify unknown species, as well as answer many questions. It includes general forest info and tree identification instructions. Then, there are 700 native and non-native trees featured, each with the same amount of information and color photos. The photos are beautiful, and the pages are sturdy, so this book is quite hefty, but durable. Size: 4.75" x 7.75" x 1.5". Great for novices and forestry majors alike.
customer_reviews.author: jenny skates

customer_reviews.title: Helpful book
customer_reviews.text: Book has been very helpful in identifying trees. It gives good clues which can help narrow down the search which can then be verified by more research in person or on the internet. One could not tell it had been used. Amazon's used book ratings are very accurate and save money.
customer_reviews.author: TNWoman

customer_reviews.title: excellent source for identifying trees
customer_reviews.text: I like especially the extra information given for each tree. Clear photos, good organization and index. One of the best tree books.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! Great pictures and very useful for primary identification. Shows the leaf, growth habit, range and sometimes it shows the bark. It is divided by leaf characteristics...lobes, compound, single, lobed, toothes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonfullofcounterfeits

customer_reviews.title: Great guide to learning trees
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this book. I've learned to identify so many trees by bringing it with me during field work (I work in wildlife ecology), on vacations to national parks, and just hiking around where I live. Very easy to use, and packed with good information.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Davis

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Field Guide, Complimentary to the Audubon Forestry Field Guides
customer_reviews.text: This field guide has a lot to offer! It is not as much of a staple as the Audubon society's field guides on trees, but this guide has interesting information about many species that cannot be found in even the Audubon. Also, it is nice to have all of Eastern and Western trees in one book (as opposed to the Audubon field guides on Eastern trees and Western trees), which is a plus for certain applications.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob H.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Great resource, but not super specific between species, only has a couple of each type, like several oaks etc. In MO we have soo many more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Handy General North American Tree Guide
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most conveniently organized general identification guide for North American trees. Handsome photographs highlight identification points through the lifecycle of tree species. Highly recommended to add to your collection. Keith Michael, New York City WILD!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Michael

customer_reviews.title: The content of this book is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for a gift but took a peek at it myself. I am very impressed with the content of the book and think she will like it very much when identifying the trees on the County trail near where we live. I might even order one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Diane C. Ham

customer_reviews.title: Lots of very nice pictures. Lots of obscure trees
customer_reviews.text: Lots of very nice pictures. Lots of obscure trees. Not enough focus on East coast varieties for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: M B

customer_reviews.title: I particularly enjoy having illustrations of the leaf
customer_reviews.text: This book includes much ecological information about the trees as well as the usual descriptions. I particularly enjoy having illustrations of the leaf, bark, flower and fruit for each species.
customer_reviews.author: Placid Lane Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Very useful! Packed with so much information that can be easily accessed and cross-referenced.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book for people like me who know a little about trees (took a class in collage) or are just starting out. The thing this has going for it is the real pictures of leaves and fruit and or nuts of the trees. Nice book overall.
customer_reviews.author: Rutter

customer_reviews.title: I brought mines used for $5 and it’s in perfect condition!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and so does the other people in my horticulture class. It is very useful an fun to carry around with you when exploring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A super resource
customer_reviews.text: A super resource. Nice pictures. A bit larger than what I'd hoped, but nicely done
customer_reviews.author: Charie

customer_reviews.title: Completes my NWF Guide collection and couldn't be more happy to have these
customer_reviews.text: Completes my NWF Guide collection and couldn't be more happy to have these. Wonderful pictures to help a beginner identify!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: A Comprehensive, Well-Designed Guide to the Trees of North America
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to take this book out in the field yet, but in just skimming through it I am already satisfied with the product. This book is very dense, and holds ample information/pictures about just about any tree in North America. Effectively divided up into sections to make identification easier. However, this is not a pocketbook field-guide, this book will easily fit in the pocket of a backpack, but do not purchase planning on receiving a thin little pamphlet that fits in you pants pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Segal

customer_reviews.title: This book is excellent. I've had a lot of fun working through ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is excellent. I've had a lot of fun working through the key to identify various trees in the PNW and elsewhere. The book is very comprehensive for a book of its size.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Lots of information and good color pictures for identification.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a very detailed book it is perfect for our area
customer_reviews.author: jennifer lobban

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tree identificaiton guides
customer_reviews.text: Really love this book one of the best tree identification guides Ive used. Shows great detail photographs of bark leaves and fruit. Organizes the trees by leaf shape and characteristics. Id say if you could only buy 1 book for identifying trees in North America this is the book to get.
customer_reviews.author: jackovknight

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, has good info
customer_reviews.text: Comprehensive and easy to find based on categories. The front cover has a foldout with an identification quick guide and a ruler. I wish it wasn't heavy, but I'm not going to take a star away for that.
customer_reviews.author: Norris

customer_reviews.title: Most complete guide I've seen!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book; very detailed and complete guide to trees As a tree "farmer" I use it almost daily to identify all the numerous trees on my property. Uses lots of pictures detailing leaves, acorns, flowers, etc ensuring accurate identification. A must for the tree enthusiast..
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: and I believe it will prove perfect for this avid outdoorsman
customer_reviews.text: Is a gift for my son,and I believe it will prove perfect for this avid outdoorsman!
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Nice guide
customer_reviews.text: I looked at this book in person along with others at B and N and this one seemed the best so I bought it here on Amazon. The pictures are helpful and the layout is pretty easy to use. I don't use the book much but its nice and cheap to have on hand if you ever need to find a specific tree.
customer_reviews.author: Willbeoutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Well illustrated with clear colour photos, and well laid out.
customer_reviews.author: R. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide Fun
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old saw this book at a nature store and really wanted it, so I knew what I was getting when I ordered this. Great field guide for trees!
customer_reviews.author: richee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Whatever your tree identification needs, this is probably the book for you. I bought this book several months ago and have found it perfect both for research and on-the-spot identification. I have used it on vacation and in my own backyard and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great tree guide
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to guide in identifying unknown trees. The vivid photographs and descriptions aid in recognizing trees. This books is referenced by many experts to be their go to guide. That is good enough for me
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great ID Books
customer_reviews.text: Great tree ID book for a great price. Easy to use key with excellent illustrations. Only addition would be some more history or uses for the included trees.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: I love trees too!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read, understand. Latin names also included - some gardener/nature types use the Latin names. Bruce Kershner, now deceased was a beloved tree/nature lover from this Western New York area. A really nice feel to this book!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book, makes tree identification much easier. Pictures and descriptions are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Identify trees and share the knowledge.
customer_reviews.text: Way more trees than I could imagine in a book this size. Not sure why I waited so long to buy one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Sabretooth

customer_reviews.title: Very valuable, accurate and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I've bought so far several volumes of these field guides, and found them very accurate. They have very good price compared to similar field guides. I checked many of their info for Ohio, Indiana and Kentucky. Also easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: guide
customer_reviews.text: Well written and great photos. I bought this for nature walks with my kids. The guide is very in depth and I doubt that I will ever utilize this book to it's full potential.
customer_reviews.author: ave-joes-view

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: We walk in the mornings and my husband wanted a tree identifier book. He likes this one very much. It's a little hefty but he brings back leaves and then studies them.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Thompson

customer_reviews.title: One of my favourite field guides
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. Excellent images, concise descriptions and crystal clear. I wish something similar was around for Europe. Even if you are not that much into botanics or trees in particular, as I wasn't when I got a copy, you will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Very informative book with great pictures. Thanks for the great service.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: This book definitely has everything you would want to know about North American trees. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: K. F. Sell

customer_reviews.title: Great Book on Trees
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry with lots of information about North American Trees. It shipped fast, and I can't wait to start using it daily. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used this book for my botany class and help get an A in the class.
customer_reviews.author: carlos n. melendez

customer_reviews.title: Best field guide for North American Trees
customer_reviews.text: I've been through many field-guides and I find that this one is more useful than any one of them. It's even more useful for my own state (Missouri), than two state-specific guides I've read. This is probably your best chance of using one field-guide to identify nearly every tree in the U.S. Multiple books will get the job done better but, again, this is the best ONE BOOK solution.
customer_reviews.author: treehouse

customer_reviews.title: Great Full Color Field Guide, Well Structured.
customer_reviews.text: Really well put together book in full color. Provides lots of information for identifying tree types in general, and has great information for identifying specific trees. I do wish they had a map for every single species, and I do with the book had a bit more width to it, but it is a field guide, so it's hard to fault them on that. The cover also claims to be waterproof. Reminds me a bit of the Readers Digest guide for North American Wildlife I loved looking at as a child.
customer_reviews.author: CNG

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to my nature library. Better than the others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mclain

customer_reviews.title: Tree book
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tree identification book. I still couldn't find one of the trees on our property in Texas though.
customer_reviews.author: Little Pecan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Resource
customer_reviews.text: My wife treasures this book. I bought it for her because I love her. Well written and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great but not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this book 4.5 stars. While most of the book is great, I would have loved some more tips on distinguishing similar or trees or subspecies. All and all a great identification book with a LOT of trees and information.
customer_reviews.author: Shak

customer_reviews.title: Tree ID Guide
customer_reviews.text: I found the book very helpful in helping me to identify a specific group of trees I had been seeing in my area.The description and drawings were good. I would have preferred more color but I would recommend the book as a reference guide
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: National Wildlife Federation Field Guide to Trees of North America
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing with so much information and pictures of trees. Even the cover is waterproof for use in the field. I bought this book so I could learn to identify trees that were good to burn in my wood stove and I've received much more information and interesting facts then I expected. I highly recommend this book for anyone who is interested in knowledge. 5 STARS for this Book.
customer_reviews.author: jomeli57

customer_reviews.title: Best tree book out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. 500+ pages with color photos of the trees, leaves, bark, everything. Very sturdy book. Waterproof cover and pages that look close to it. I'll be taking this book with me everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: JoeB

customer_reviews.title: take good notes and use this to look it up when ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have some big pockets, you can carry this tome with you on your hike. Otherwise, take good notes and use this to look it up when you get home. It's all there. If you are planning a career in forestry, however, this might well be your new best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Another Excellent Tree Book
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pages, lots of text and very nice pictures. The Federation did an excellent job with Bruce Kershner's book and Bruce did a nice job as author.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Abdalla

customer_reviews.title: TREES
customer_reviews.text: Book arrived promptly in excellent condition. Great resource! We were looking to replace a tree that had been removed at our home and wanted a reference book to expand our considerations. Since we're both retired we anticipate discovering and identifying eye catching trees as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY J. BADMAN

customer_reviews.title: Nearly the perfect guide
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for 2 reasons. One, of course, to have a guide to use if out and about that will help identify trees....although its heavier than expected and may weigh down your backpack - HOWEVER, they used very sturdy paper (probably to protect against outdoor elements), which is why its a little heavy for its size. The second reason was to use it as a reference in my writing. In this is fulfills expectations PERFECTLY. The only thing I could wish for is an index by regional/geographic zone. They do cover the types of forest and what general trees that tend to grow in them at the beginning, but an index would be fab.
customer_reviews.author: L. Michele Scott

customer_reviews.title: Woodland Adventurer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book for a friend who is always outdoors, and he loves it. It's great for figuring out the surrounding area and makes hiking a little more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: MissJess

customer_reviews.title: Responding
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, this book for my Grandson and he loves it. He is getting an entire set. He likes the waterproof cover, Thanks, Karen
customer_reviews.author: Karen Wright

customer_reviews.title: It is a fantastic guide with great pictures and usable information but I ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a fantastic guide with great pictures and usable information but I was using it as a study guide for a dendrology class and it could not handle that kind of use. The binding all started coming apart. I think its because the waterproof cover isn't very bendable so the glue gave before the cover bent.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: Very useful book
customer_reviews.text: This book was better than I expected. great pictures and details of leaves and bark. Easy to see the range of the trees.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide
customer_reviews.text: I knew very little about the kinds of trees and enjoy hiking. Bringing the book along helps to identify while hiking and the ones I am not sure about near our new home, pretty good fit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tree Book to End all Tree Books
customer_reviews.text: Really great. Everything you ever wished would be compiled into one tree book is in here! They even included a little ruler along the inside of the cover, so you're set. Beautiful and informative.
customer_reviews.author: Whim2Wander

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best book I've found on identifying trees Love the layout and information
customer_reviews.author: Mark Taggart

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: We spend a lot of time in the woods and this book has been so useful. Our even ask to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine owned this book and recommended it as a good field guide to have in our library. As a Homeschooler, I am wanting to build up a nice selection of choice guides for our nature study. This one has great photos and descriptions, with pictures of the leaves along with the appearance of the tree. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift to a friend and they liked it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Evans

customer_reviews.title: good pick
customer_reviews.text: very graphic and informative. Has hundreds of different species of trees from all the states. A great reference book to have.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with great photos and descriptions. Small and thick book.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Waldron

customer_reviews.title: photo guide to american trees
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book for the field.However a lot of usuable info left out being a photo book eg tree forms are often neglected.
customer_reviews.author: david more

customer_reviews.title: Tree Feild Guide
customer_reviews.text: this book has very good descriptions and images to help identify trees. Only problem is that it is just a little to bulky to bring out to the field all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah N. Rothleder

customer_reviews.title: The book does a great job of putting the trees in categories that make ...
customer_reviews.text: The book does a great job of putting the trees in categories that make them easier to find in the book. the only thing I don't like about the book is it does not give you any information about the tree.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Trees
customer_reviews.text: National Wildlife Federation Field Guide wasn't as good as expected. I will pass it on to our library store.
customer_reviews.author: Curtrenton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Energy and body language are the keys to understanding you dog/s.
customer_reviews.author: linda fielder

customer_reviews.title: A DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: WAS BOUND IUN SUCH A MANNER THAT SOME OF THE PAGES WERE NOT ENTIRELY VISABLE. WAS SIM;PLY NOT WHAT I EXPECTED
customer_reviews.author: barbara ismond
